channel.title: Json on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Json on Notes

item.title: JSON Serialization with Go
item.description: Networked programs need to exchange information via messages. TCP and UDP provide a transport mechanism to do this. However, at transport level the messages are just sequences of bytes with no structure. A program will typically build a complex data structure to hold the current program state. To transfer this data outside of the program’s own address space (e.g. to another application over the network) it needs to be serialized. This process is also called marshalling or encoding.
